title: Barbara Stanwyck
summary: Barbara Stanwyck (born Ruby Catherine Stevens; July 16, 1907 â€“ January 20, 1990) was an American actress, model and dancer. A stage, film, and television star, during her 60-year career as a consummate professional she was known for her strong, realistic screen presence and versatility. A favorite of directors including Cecil B. DeMille, Fritz Lang, and Frank Capra, she made 85 films in 38 years before turning to television.
